org.forgerock.opendj.ldap

Class LDAPOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.forgerock.opendj.ldap.LDAPOptions

  • public final class LDAPOptions
extends Object
    Common options for LDAP client connections.

    For example you set LDAP options when you want to use StartTLS. 

     LDAPOptions options = new LDAPOptions();
 SSLContext sslContext =
         new SSLContextBuilder().setTrustManager(...).getSSLContext();
 options.setSSLContext(sslContext);
 options.setUseStartTLS(true);

 String host = ...;
 int port = ...;
 LDAPConnectionFactory factory = new LDAPConnectionFactory(host, port, options);
 Connection connection = factory.getConnection();
 // Connection uses StartTLS...

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LDAPOptions()
      Creates a new set of connection options with default settings.
      LDAPOptions(LDAPOptions options)
      Creates a new set of connection options having the same initial set of options as the provided set of connection options.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LDAPOptions

        public LDAPOptions()
        Creates a new set of connection options with default settings. SSL will not be enabled, and a default set of decode options will be used.

      • LDAPOptions

        public LDAPOptions(LDAPOptions options)
        Creates a new set of connection options having the same initial set of options as the provided set of connection options.
        Parameters:
        options - The set of connection options to be copied.

    • Method Detail

      • addEnabledCipherSuite

        public LDAPOptions addEnabledCipherSuite(String... suites)
        Adds the cipher suites enabled for secure connections with the Directory Server.

        The suites must be supported by the SSLContext specified in setSSLContext(SSLContext). Following a successful call to this method, only the suites listed in the protocols parameter are enabled for use.

        Parameters:
        suites - Names of all the suites to enable.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • addEnabledProtocol

        public LDAPOptions addEnabledProtocol(String... protocols)
        Adds the protocol versions enabled for secure connections with the Directory Server.

        The protocols must be supported by the SSLContext specified in setSSLContext(SSLContext). Following a successful call to this method, only the protocols listed in the protocols parameter are enabled for use.

        Parameters:
        protocols - Names of all the protocols to enable.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • getConnectTimeout

        public long getConnectTimeout(TimeUnit unit)
        Returns the connect timeout in the specified unit. If a connection is not established within the timeout period, then a TimeoutResultException error result will be returned. A timeout setting of 0 causes the OS connect timeout to be used.

        The default operation timeout is 10 seconds and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.connectTimeout property.

        Parameters:
        unit - The time unit.
        Returns:
        The connect timeout, which may be 0 if there is no connect timeout.

      • getEnabledCipherSuites

        public List<String> getEnabledCipherSuites()
        Returns the names of the protocol versions which are currently enabled for secure connections with the Directory Server.
        Returns:
        An array of protocols or empty set if the default protocols are to be used.

      • getEnabledProtocols

        public List<String> getEnabledProtocols()
        Returns the names of the protocol versions which are currently enabled for secure connections with the Directory Server.
        Returns:
        An array of protocols or empty set if the default protocols are to be used.

      • getSSLContext

        public SSLContext getSSLContext()
        Returns the SSL context which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server.

        By default no SSL context will be used, indicating that connections will not be secured. If a non-null SSL context is returned then connections will be secured using either SSL or StartTLS depending on useStartTLS().

        Returns:
        The SSL context which will be used when initiating secure connections with the Directory Server, which may be null indicating that connections will not be secured.

      • getTimeout

        public long getTimeout(TimeUnit unit)
        Returns the operation timeout in the specified unit. If a response is not received from the Directory Server within the timeout period, then the operation will be abandoned and a TimeoutResultException error result returned. A timeout setting of 0 disables operation timeout limits.

        The default operation timeout is 0 (no timeout) and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.timeout property.

        Parameters:
        unit - The time unit.
        Returns:
        The operation timeout, which may be 0 if there is no operation timeout.

      • setConnectTimeout

        public LDAPOptions setConnectTimeout(long timeout,
                            TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the connect timeout. If a connection is not established within the timeout period, then a TimeoutResultException error result will be returned. A timeout setting of 0 causes the OS connect timeout to be used.

        The default operation timeout is 10 seconds and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.connectTimeout property.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The connect timeout, which may be 0 if there is no connect timeout.
        unit - The time unit.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • setSSLContext

        public LDAPOptions setSSLContext(SSLContext sslContext)
        Sets the SSL context which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server.

        By default no SSL context will be used, indicating that connections will not be secured. If a non-null SSL context is returned then connections will be secured using either SSL or StartTLS depending on useStartTLS().

        Parameters:
        sslContext - The SSL context which will be used when initiating secure connections with the Directory Server, which may be null indicating that connections will not be secured.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • setTimeout

        public LDAPOptions setTimeout(long timeout,
                     TimeUnit unit)
        Sets the operation timeout. If a response is not received from the Directory Server within the timeout period, then the operation will be abandoned and a TimeoutResultException error result returned. A timeout setting of 0 disables operation timeout limits.

        The default operation timeout is 0 (no timeout) and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.timeout property.

        Parameters:
        timeout - The operation timeout, which may be 0 if there is no operation timeout.
        unit - The time unit.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • setUseStartTLS

        public LDAPOptions setUseStartTLS(boolean useStartTLS)
        Specifies whether or not SSL or StartTLS should be used for securing connections when an SSL context is specified.

        By default SSL will be used in preference to StartTLS.

        Parameters:
        useStartTLS - true if StartTLS should be used for securing connections when an SSL context is specified, otherwise false indicating that SSL should be used.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • useStartTLS

        public boolean useStartTLS()
        Indicates whether or not SSL or StartTLS should be used for securing connections when an SSL context is specified.

        By default SSL will be used in preference to StartTLS.

        Returns:
        true if StartTLS should be used for securing connections when an SSL context is specified, otherwise false indicating that SSL should be used.

      • setDecodeOptions

        public LDAPOptions setDecodeOptions(DecodeOptions decodeOptions)
        Sets the decoding options which will be used to control how requests and responses are decoded.
        Parameters:
        decodeOptions - The decoding options which will be used to control how requests and responses are decoded (never null).
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • setTCPNIOTransport

        public LDAPOptions setTCPNIOTransport(org.glassfish.grizzly.nio.transport.TCPNIOTransport transport)
        Sets the Grizzly TCP transport which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server.

        By default this method will return null indicating that the default transport factory should be used to obtain a TCP transport.

        Parameters:
        transport - The Grizzly TCP transport which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server, or null if the default transport factory should be used to obtain a TCP transport.
        Returns:
        A reference to this connection options.

      • getDecodeOptions

        public DecodeOptions getDecodeOptions()
        Returns the decoding options which will be used to control how requests and responses are decoded.
        Returns:
        The decoding options which will be used to control how requests and responses are decoded (never null).

      • getLinger

        public int getLinger()
        Returns the value of the SO_LINGER socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is -1 (disabled) and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.linger property.

        Returns:
        The value of the SO_LINGER socket option for new connections, or -1 if linger should be disabled.

      • isKeepAlive

        public boolean isKeepAlive()
        Returns the value of the SO_KEEPALIVE socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is true and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.keepAlive property.

        Returns:
        The value of the SO_KEEPALIVE socket option for new connections.

      • isReuseAddress

        public boolean isReuseAddress()
        Returns the value of the SO_REUSEADDR socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is true and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.reuseAddress property.

        Returns:
        The value of the SO_REUSEADDR socket option for new connections.

      • isTCPNoDelay

        public boolean isTCPNoDelay()
        Returns the value of the TCP_NODELAY socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is true and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.tcpNoDelay property.

        Returns:
        The value of the TCP_NODELAY socket option for new connections.

      • setKeepAlive

        public T setKeepAlive(boolean keepAlive)
        Specifies the value of the SO_KEEPALIVE socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is true and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.keepAlive property.

        Parameters:
        keepAlive - The value of the SO_KEEPALIVE socket option for new connections.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • setLinger

        public T setLinger(int linger)
        Specifies the value of the SO_LINGER socket option for new connections.

        The default setting is -1 (disabled) and may be configured using the org.forgerock.opendj.io.linger property.

        Parameters:
        linger - The value of the SO_LINGER socket option for new connections, or -1 if linger should be disabled.
        Returns:
        A reference to this set of options.

      • getTCPNIOTransport

        public org.glassfish.grizzly.nio.transport.TCPNIOTransport getTCPNIOTransport()
        Returns the Grizzly TCP transport which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server.

        By default this method will return null indicating that the default transport factory should be used to obtain a TCP transport.

        Returns:
        The Grizzly TCP transport which will be used when initiating connections with the Directory Server, or null if the default transport factory should be used to obtain a TCP transport.
